overflow.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges
overflow.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The drains flooded and water overflowed down the main street.
The river had overflowed its banks.
waste bins overflowing with plastic cups
overflow.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to have a lot of something
overflow.translation[0].definitions[1].e: He was overflowing with good ideas.
overflow.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if a place overflows with people or people overflow into a place, there are too many of them to fit into it
overflow.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Hospitals were reported to be overflowing with dead and wounded.
The house was full and people were overflowing into the street.
overflow.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to have a very strong feeling
overflow.translation[0].definitions[3].e: My heart was overflowing with gratitude.
overflow.translation[1].definitions[0].d: the amount of something or the number of people that cannot be contained in a place because it is already full
overflow.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The overflow will be accommodated in another hotel.
the overflow of water from the lake
overflow.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a pipe through which water flows out of a container when it becomes too full
